(A39 → (¬(A34 → A35) → A36)).natural: If the drug company subcontracts production to a third party, then, under the condition that it is not the case that whenever the painkiller drug experiences demand in the market it meets supply in the market, the painkiller drug faces a shortage in the market.

(A4 → ¬A3).natural: Whenever the drug company passes inspection by the regulatory agency, it does not violate regulations set by the regulatory agency.

(A41 → A40).natural: On the condition that the drug company destroys the prototype for the painkiller drug, it maintains the prototype for the painkiller drug.

(A43 → A42).natural: If the furniture company sources sustainably from the forest, then it uses natural wood material.

(A44 → A43).natural: Provided that the furniture company plants trees in the reforestation project, it sources sustainably from the forest.

(A5 → A34).natural: Under the condition that the drug company manufactures the painkiller drug, the painkiller drug experiences demand in the market.

(A5 → A6).natural: In the event that the drug company manufactures the painkiller drug, the painkiller drug has severe side effects.

(A5 → A7).natural: If the drug company manufactures the painkiller drug, then the painkiller drug is approved by the regulatory agency.

(A5 → ¬A6).natural: Provided that the drug company manufactures the painkiller drug, it does not have severe side effects.

(A5 ∨ G).natural: The drug company manufactures the painkiller drug or it is a profitable business.

(A7 → ¬A6).natural: On the condition that the painkiller drug is approved by the regulatory agency, it does not have severe side effects.

(A8 → (A7 → ¬A6)).natural: If the drug company conducts research in a clinical trial, then, given that the painkiller drug is approved by the regulatory agency, it does not have severe side effects.

(A8 ∨ A9).natural: Either the drug company conducts research in a clinical trial or it develops the formula for the painkiller drug.

(A9 → (A7 → ¬A6)).natural: Provided that the drug company develops the formula for the painkiller drug, if the painkiller drug is approved by the regulatory agency, then it does not have severe side effects.

(A9 → A10).natural: Under the condition that the drug company develops the formula for the painkiller drug, it obtains a patent for the painkiller drug.

(A9 → A28).natural: In the event that the drug company develops the formula for the painkiller drug, it improves the formula for the painkiller drug.

(¬(A2 ∨ (¬G → A1)) → A3).natural: If it is not the case that either the drug company possesses production capacity at the facility or, if it is not a profitable business, then it holds drug approval from the regulatory agency, then the drug company violates regulations set by the regulatory agency.

(¬(A31 → A30) → A32).natural: Provided that it is not the case that if the drug company modifies the ingredients for the painkiller drug then it updates the labeling for the painkiller drug, the drug company maintains the formula for the painkiller drug.

(¬(A31 → A30) → A33).natural: On the condition that it is not the case that if the drug company modifies the ingredients for the painkiller drug then it updates the labeling for the painkiller drug, the drug company alters the dosage for the painkiller drug.

(¬(A31 → A30) → ¬A32).natural: If it is not the case that whenever the drug company modifies the ingredients for the painkiller drug it updates the labeling for the painkiller drug, then the drug company does not maintain the formula for the painkiller drug.

(¬(A34 → A35) → A36).natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the painkiller drug experiences demand in the market then it meets supply in the market, the painkiller drug faces a shortage in the market.

(¬(A7 → ¬A6) → A44).natural: On the condition that it is not the case that under the condition the painkiller drug is approved by the regulatory agency it does not have severe side effects, the furniture company plants trees in the reforestation project.

(¬(A7 → ¬A6) → ¬A42).natural: In the event that it is not the case that provided the painkiller drug is approved by the regulatory agency it does not have severe side effects, the furniture company does not use natural wood material.

(¬(A9 → (A7 → ¬A6)) → A41).natural: Provided that it is not the case that if the drug company develops the formula for the painkiller drug then, under the condition the painkiller drug is approved by the regulatory agency, it does not have severe side effects, the drug company destroys the prototype for the painkiller drug.

(¬(A9 → (A7 → ¬A6)) → ¬A40).natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the drug company develops the formula for the painkiller drug then, on the condition the painkiller drug is approved by the regulatory agency, it does not have severe side effects, the drug company does not maintain the prototype for the painkiller drug.

(¬(A9 → A28) → A29).natural: If it is not the case that if the drug company develops the formula for the painkiller drug then it improves the formula for the painkiller drug, then the drug company changes the packaging for the painkiller drug.

(¬(A9 → A28) → A31).natural: On the condition that it is not the case that if the drug company develops the formula for the painkiller drug then it improves the formula for the painkiller drug, the drug company modifies the ingredients for the painkiller drug.

(¬(¬G → A11) → A12).natural: If it is not the case that if the drug company is not a profitable business then it needs to recall the painkiller drug, then the regulatory agency issues a warning to the drug company.

(¬(¬G → A11) → A13).natural: Provided that it is not the case that under the condition the drug company is not a profitable business it needs to recall the painkiller drug, the regulatory agency initiates an investigation into the drug company.
